channel.title: A Few Questions
channel.description:
Hey everyone I would like to ask a few questions.
(1) I have been thinking about learning the programming language Java, Is it worth it or should I learn something else?
(2) People have been saying the latest mIRC 6.21 is a virus. Is this true?
(3) At school I am going to get mIRC (We are allowed to get anything we want :cool: ) but my school has Mcafee 2006 and Windows Defender. How would I allow mIRC connect to the internet by letting it through those programs. My schools user accounts are Limited as far as I know and are running Windows XP Professional Version. I am thinking maybe the Windows Firewall could make an exception but with no access to the control panel (none that I know) and only access to My Computer and some others I don't see a way to get into control panel unless there is some sort of icon in C drive that allows you to get to the Control panel or some other way.
Thanks in advance :)

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @pko pko
item.description:
@pko wrote:

Lawl is right though, because java is better for many other things, besides RS cheating, and is also a good begginers language, or you could learn c#, because there is a lack of C# coders.

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @h44ckzor_pwnage h44ckzor pwnage
item.description:
@h44ckzor_pwnage wrote:

mIRC properly installs but it doesn’t connect to any server. I am thinking that the anti-virus programs or the firewall are blocking it so I need some way to make an exception.

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I’m not sure Limited accounts are allowed to install programs.

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

1.) If you have no other knowledge in programming I wouldn’t personally recommend Java unless you are very ambitious. I would start out with something easier like Visual Basics.

2.) Already answered.

3.) I honestly don’t know because it varies from school to school, if you are actually allowed to install whatever you like then I would recommend asking one of the staff, otherwise search around on Google.

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Don’t learn Java, tbh. Only learn Java if your interested in Runescape cheating. VB might be a good start.

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

mIRC 6.21 is NOT a virus and why would you dl it to school if you even had the slightest doubt that it was a virus. but to clear things up, it is not a virus

Read full topic
